ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Have you ever experienced, witnessed, or been repeatedly confronted with any of the following: Serious, life threatening illness (heart attack, etc.)
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Have you ever experienced, witnessed, or been repeatedly confronted with any of the following: Physical Assault (attacked with a weapon, severe injuries from a fight, held at gunpoint, etc.)
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Have you ever experienced, witnessed, or been repeatedly confronted with any of the following: Sexual assault (rape, attempted rape, forced sexual act with a weapon, etc.)
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Have you ever experienced, witnessed, or been repeatedly confronted with any of the following: Military combat or lived in a war zone
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Have you ever experienced, witnessed, or been repeatedly confronted with any of the following: Child abuse (severe beatings, sexual acts with someone 5 years older than you, etc.)
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Have you ever experienced, witnessed, or been repeatedly confronted with any of the following: Accident (serious injury or death from a car, at work, a house fire, etc.)
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Have you ever experienced, witnessed, or been repeatedly confronted with any of the following: Natural disaster (severe hurricane, flood, earthquake, etc.)
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Have you ever experienced, witnessed, or been repeatedly confronted with any of the following: Other trauma
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Have you ever experienced, witnessed, or been repeatedly confronted with any of the following: Other trauma (please describe briefly)
Which single traumatic experience is on your mind and currently bothers you the most:
Notes: 1=Serious, life threatening illness; 2=Physical assault; 3=Sexual assault; 4=Military combat or lived in a war zone; 5=Child abuse; 6=Accident; 7=Natural Disaster; 8=Other trauma

ElementDescription: Which single traumatic experience is on your mind and currently bothers you the most: Other trauma (please describe briefly)
Please specify the time period being reported (In the past week, in the past month, 3 months, etc.)
Unwanted upsetting memories about the trauma
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Very much; 4=Severe; 5=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Bad dreams or nightmares related to the trauma
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Very much; 4=Severe; 5=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Reliving the traumatic event or feeling as if it were actually happening again
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Very much; 4=Severe; 5=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Feeling very EMOTIONALLY upset when reminded of the trauma
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Very much; 4=Severe; 5=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Having PHYSICAL reactions when reminded of the trauma (for example, sweating, heart racing)
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Very much; 4=Severe; 5=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Trying to avoid thoughts or feelings related to the trauma
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Very much; 4=Severe; 5=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Trying to avoid activities, situations, or places that remind you of the trauma or that feel more dangerous since the trauma
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Very much; 4=Severe; 5=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Not being able to remember important parts of the trauma
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Very much; 4=Severe; 5=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Seeing yourself, others, or the world in a more negative way (for example 'I can't trust people,' 'I'm a weak person')
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Very much; 4=Severe; 5=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Blaming yourself or others (besides the person who hurt you) for what happened
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Very much; 4=Severe; 5=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Having intense negative feelings like fear, horror, anger, guilt or shame
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Very much; 4=Severe; 5=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Losing interest or not participating in activities you used to do
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Very much; 4=Severe; 5=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Feeling distant or cut off from others
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Very much; 4=Severe; 5=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Having difficulty experiencing positive feelings
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Very much; 4=Severe; 5=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Acting more irritable or aggressive with others
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Very much; 4=Severe; 5=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Taking more risks or doing things that might cause you or others harm (for example, driving recklessly, taking drugs, having unprotected sex)
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Very much; 4=Severe; 5=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Being overly alert or on-guard (for example, checking to see who is around you, being uncomfortable with your back to a door)
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Very much; 4=Severe; 5=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Being jumpy or more easily startled (for example when someone walks up behind you)
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Very much; 4=Severe; 5=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Having trouble concentrating
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Very much; 4=Severe; 5=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Having trouble falling or staying asleep
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Very much; 4=Severe; 5=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: How much have these difficulties been bothering you?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Very much; 4=Severe; 5=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: How much have these difficulties been interfering with your everyday life (for example relationships, work, or other important activities)?
Notes: 0=Not at all; 1=A little; 2=Somewhat; 3=Very much; 4=Severe; 5=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: How long after the trauma did these difficulties begin?
Notes: 0=Less than 6 months; 1=More than 6 months; 2=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: How long have you had these trauma-related difficulties?
Notes: 0=Less than 1 month; 1=More than 1 month; 2=Prefer not to answer
